snippet: G.M. said a senior engineer is retiring, bringing to four the number of executives who have left since the carmaker admitted it failed for years to recall cars with faulty ignition switches.
abstract: General Motors says that senior engineer Jim Federico will retire; he is fourth executive who has retired or resigned since automaker admitted that it failed for years to recall cars with faulty ignition switches linked to 13 deaths.
lead_paragraph: G.M. said a senior engineer is retiring, bringing to four the number of executives who have left since the carmaker admitted it failed for years to recall cars with faulty ignition switches.

headline.main: Another General Motors Official to Leave
headline.print_headline: G.M. Official Joining List of Departed
